intro: Rohria sulcata, commonly known as the warty rohria, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its distinctive, warty tubercles on its stems and leaves. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a pungent odor, similar to other members of its family.
